Text:
Hi,
Downloaded ok, opened ok but when I select the app file and it starts doing it's business (I enter the system password and grant it permissions) i get an Error message. That's it. Has anyone got any idea what's going on? I would appreciate your help. Thanks.
That's because it's a trojan and you entered your password. Check your startup processes and look for it.

This is not a trojan.

I don't remember if I got my Sims 2 app from here or not but I'm running an intel mac and it's crashing at certain points during the game.  I checked the file information and it appears that this file is meant for a power pc... not intel.  Probably why it's having issues.  I'll have to load it on my G5 to see if the problem resolves.

To everyone having problems running the patch, getting errors including reference to "libcrypto", check out the page:
http://smartic.us/2007/10/27/leopard-and-non-native-crypto-libraries
It solves the issue with any program using "the wrong architecture" or libcrypto or libssl.

Note: I still cannot successfully patch Sims 2 yet, but at least I can run the iPatcher! MacBook with 10.5.2.

Does anyone know how to go from rev f to rev e?  I tried downloading a patch for rev e that was 28.6 mb.  It installs on the HD volume and doesn't downgrade my rev f file to rev e.  I had success with downgrading to rev c but I think that goes too far for intel support. (Doesn't work.)

Any help appreciated!
